intro: Lapeirousia erythrantha f. albescens, commonly known as the white-flowered leopard's ear, is a rare and striking member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, waxy, white petals that contrast sharply with its green, velvety foliage. Native to the Western Cape of South Africa, this plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers bloom in late winter to early spring, adding a unique touch to the local flora. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is highly sought after by horticulturists and conservationists alike.
